      • getAppDescription

        protected java.lang.String getAppDescription()
        Returns a description of this application. If present it will be displayed together with the usage string that is output by the method Application.printUsage(PrintStream). The default implementation returns NULL.
        Overrides:
        getAppDescription in class Application
        Returns:
        The application description

      • getCommandLineOptions

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getCommandLineOptions()
        Can be overridden by subclasses to provide a mapping from allowed command line options to corresponding help text string. The default implementation returns an empty map to indicate that arbitrary options are allowed. See the documentation of class CommandLine for more information.
        Overrides:
        getCommandLineOptions in class Application
        Returns:
        A mapping from allowed command line options to help texts

      • handleCommands

        protected void handleCommands(CommandLine rCommandLine,
                              java.lang.String rContext,
                              java.lang.String rTarget)
        Handles all commands provided on the command line.
        Parameters:
        rCommandLine - The command line
        rContext - The optional command context
        rTarget - The optional command target

      • runApp

        protected void runApp()
               throws java.lang.Exception
        This is the main method that must be implemented by all subclasses. It contains the code the will perform the applications actual work task(s). The implementation may throw exceptions to signal errors but it must be aware that this will skip any final application method invocations. If final cleanup tasks need to be run anyway the implementation should do so in the method Application.handleApplicationError(Exception), e.g. by invoking the Application.cleanup() method.
        Specified by:
        runApp in class Application
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Subclasses may throw exceptions to signal errors
